acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours EC50=0.97mg/L of the algae (Scenedesmus) (SIDS (1998)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since LD50 value of the dermal administration test employing guinea pig was 10 mL/kg (8,309 mg/kg) (SIDS (1992)), it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It is written that in 1-hour, 6-hour, or 18-hour inhalation exposure test employing rats, there was no mortality with 1.05 mg/L in any exposure time (SIDS (1992)). Since it is a liquid whose saturated vapor pressure level at 25degC is 0.0086 mg/L, 4-hour LC50 value equivalent is considered to be >0.2625 mg/L when applying the mist standard. Since classification cannot be specified, classification is not possible.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Although the oral administration test employing a rat showed that LD50 value >12.8 mL/kg of (10,600 mg/kg), >36 mL/kg (29,880 mg/kg) (above, SIDS (1992)), >10,600 mg/kg, and >12,800 mg/kg (above, Patty (5th, 2001)), since all of them exceeded the baseline of Category 4, they were classified into "Not classified".

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made and there is no data, classification is not possible. In addition, there is a description that "the statistical increase in a lung neoplasm was not seen in the intraperitoneal injection experiment employing mouse. Although mild cancer adjuvant effect was seen by repeated topical use, there is a question in a conclusion because the difference between a processing group and a non-processing group is small" (SIDS (1992)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 1, since there were bio-accumulation (LogKow=5.13 (PHYSPROP Database (2008))), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it was negative in the body cell in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus tests which employed the mouse bone marrow cell) (SIDS (1992)), it was classified into "Not classified".

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including oxygen, not fluorine and chlorine, this oxygen has not chemically bound to any elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously (ignition temperature 275degC (Lide,88th,2007)).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: In a combined repeated dose toxicity study and reproductive/developmental toxicity screening study in rats (OECD TG 422, GLP), it was reported that "for parental toxicity, although there was a slight decrease in conception rates it was not statistically significant, there was no change in the gestation period, and abnormalities of the reproductive organs were not observed. For developmental toxicity, there were no changes in natality rates, offspring weight, mortality rates or sex distribution, and no abnormalities were observed during autopsies" (SIDS (1992)). Since this study was a simple test, however, classification is not possible.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: This substance was set to Category 2B since it showed a "mild irritation (mainly to conjunctiva)" in the eye irritation test employing rabbits for the commercial Laurylalcohol A and B in 68.9% and 63.3% of each of which this substance was contained (SIDS (1992)), and every rabbit recovered in 14 days. In addition, each ingredient of the commercial Laurylalcohol A and B is a higher alcohol, being indicated below. A: C10 accounts for 0.3%, C12 for 68.9%, C14 for 25.1%, C16 for 5.1%, and C18 for 0.3%. Remaining 0.3% is unidentified. B: C10 accounts for 0.1%, C12 for 63.3%, C14 for 24.1%, C16 for 8.3%, and C18 for 0.4%. Remaining 3.8% is unidentified.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified into "Not classified" because of "not irritating" (IUCLID (2000)) in a 4-hour skin irritation/corrosion test to human (OECD TG 404, GLP). In addition, although there has been a description of "highly irritating" (IUCLID (2000)) in the Draize test with rabbits, it has been described in the primary literature (J. Soc. Cosmet. Chem. 28 (1977)) that the test was a 24-hour test and "the degree of irritation declines in order of rabbits, guinea pig, mise, and humans." Moreover, there has been a description of "slight to moderate irritation" (Patty (5th, 2001)) in the 24-hour skin irritation tests employing rabbits and mice. Since either of them are a 24-hour test, they cannot be employed.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is a data of "not sensitizing" (IUCLID (2000)) in the Maximization tests to humans (volunteers of 25 persons), classification is not possible since the source of information is from List2 and data is insufficient.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is written in the combination test of repeated dose toxicity study and reproduction screening study in rats (OECD TG 422, GLP) that there were no pathological effects, however, there were decrease in number of white blood cells and decrease in plasma free cholesterol" (SIDS (1992)) . Since effects on the blood are found out of the scope of Category 2, classification is not possible.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a description of "Sign of lung irritation, mild breathing difficulty, mild hemorrhage in the lungs" occur in the inhalation exposure test employing rats (SIDS (1992)), and since all cases were seen within the range of the guidance value of Category 2, it was classified into Category 2 (lungs).
